summary: This document is a chain of internal FBI emails from late June/early July 2020 requesting and approving travel expenses for an operation to arrest a target (Ghislaine Maxwell) in the Epstein investigation. The emails discuss shifting the operation from Massachusetts to New Hampshire based on phone location data and the need to move technical assets.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as the target of the FBI's arrest operation in the Epstein investigation. Historical phone data indicates she was in New Hampshire.

events.title: FBI planning for Maxwell arrest operation
events.description: Internal FBI email chain discussing and approving travel plans for an operation to arrest Ghislaine Maxwell. The plan shifted from Massachusetts to New Hampshire based on historical phone location data.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively planning an operation to arrest Ghislaine Maxwell in late June/early July 2020.
Historical phone location data indicated Maxwell was in New Hampshire, causing the FBI to shift their operational focus from Massachusetts.
The operation required moving technical assets from Boston and Newark to assist in locating Maxwell's phone.
The emails show detailed planning for travel, lodging, and expenses for FBI personnel involved in the arrest operation.
